alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 05 at 3:50AM MDT until May 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING FOR THE LOWLANDS AND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO... .A strong upper low pressure system over the Great Basin will induce a moderately strong surface low in southeast Colorado and result in windy conditions this afternoon. Temperatures remain near average for early May with deep thermal mixing during the afternoon and very dry air. Southwest winds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph are expected today. Minimum RHs will be 6 to 10 percent in the lowlands and 10 to 15 percent in the mountains. Fire weather conditions will improve tonight as winds subside and relative humidity recovers above critical levels. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR BREEZY WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 110, 111, 112, AND 113... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 110, 111, 112, and 113. * WIND...Southwest winds at 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...6 to 10 percent in the lowlands. 10 to 15 percent in the mountains. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
